author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1705776264}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261957551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1544351123}
review:
I don't quite understand why you'd want to play this game when [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/350740/The_Bug_Butcher/]Bug Butcher[/url] does the same thing, has a much more polished UI, costs the same price and doesn't require useless and clunky platforming.

[edit: Fixed the Bug Butcher URL]

At nearly $10, this game is way overpriced. It's more like a choppy android game that someone developer pooped out over a weekend than a real game. Just look at the UI graphics and tell me it doesn't immediately come off as a default stock option from some dime-a-dozen "build a game" program. The developer does seem to try, but their efforts are put in the wrong place, because the "main menu" is just straight up clunky and drives home the point of "just because you can, doesn't mean you should". The game sets a very poor first impression, and it only goes downhill from there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030516476', 'num_games_owned': 5534, 'num_reviews': 465, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1540898784}
review:
J'ai beaucoup de mal avec ce genre de petits jeux de plateforme qui souvent prennent le dessus et me tapent sur le nerfs, je finis toujours par les laisser trainer dans un coin pour ne plus jamais y revenir.

Mais pourtant ici mÃªme si il y a un certain challenge, j'y ai pris Ã©normÃ©ment de plaisir et je l'ai terminÃ© jusqu'au bout !!! 
Il n'est pas diffÃ©rent des autres question frustration, j'ai recommencÃ© plus d'une fois certains niveaux, mais il m'a rappelÃ© tellement de souvenirs avec son mÃ©lange de graphismes d'antan aux allures d'un super mario et au gameplay d'un pang j'ai adorÃ©.

J'ai ragÃ© Ã  quelques mÃ¨tres juste avant la fin du niveau quand je me suis glitchÃ© dans un des murs du haut en jouant Ã  Tarzan :

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1549412399


J'ai ragÃ© sur la hit box qui dÃ©conne parfois, mais ce jeu est une perle pour celles et ceux aimant les jeux d'arcade oldschool, il ne rÃ©volutionne certes pas le monde du jeu vidÃ©o, mais reste trÃ¨s addictif et trÃ¨s plaisant et on fera fi de ses petits dÃ©fauts. 

J'ai bien aimÃ© son gameplay : me balancer Ã  l'aide du grappin mÃªme si parfois celui-ci n'accrochais pas comme je le voulais lÃ  oÃ¹ il faut - en mÃªme temps je ne suis pas une as de ce genre de jeux - puis me propulser dans les airs pour m'aggriper tel un aimant sur les parois en hauteur,  et son monde paralÃ¨lle auquel on accÃ¨de grace aux tÃ©lÃ©porteurs, mais surtout trucider les bouboules qui se divisent et subdivisent encore faÃ§on Pang.

Le seul bÃ©mol est l'histoire et la cinÃ©matique entre les niveaux, j'ai du zapper car les textes dÃ©filent trop vite, on n'a pas le temps de lire et du coup on laisse tomber ce qui se dit en terme d'histoire de fond.

quelques petites illustrations en images : 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1549411156

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1549410915

Franchement je n'en attendais rien d'exceptionnel, et finalement j'ai beaucoup aimÃ©.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136373263', 'num_games_owned': 1352, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1525497681}
review: This game is a real ball buster! I really am a sucker for these type of games, brings me back to my days of playing the Buster Bros. collection on playstation with some light-platforming thrown in. I definitely appreciate additions to the game like the grappling hook, the game could benefit from an endless mode or co-op but pick it up if you see it on sale (i got my copy in the Lazy Guys Discovery Bundle)

author: {'steamid': '76561198085062858', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1515747316}
review:
Really nice game, with the right level of difficulty in my opinion! The atmosphere and the musics are great, and the general principle of destroying the spheroids, as old as it is, stays fun throughout the whole game! 
Only thing that could be improved in my opinion: the texts with the scientists go way too fast to be read, maybe could it be a bit slowed down?
